Package io.github.ethankelly

Class GraphGenerator

java.lang.Object
io.github.ethankelly.GraphGenerator
public class GraphGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
The GraphGenerator class provides several methods for creating various graphs, including Erdos-Renyi random graphs, random bipartite graphs, random k-regular graphs, and random rooted trees.

  • Method Details

    • simple

      public static Graph simple​(int numVertices, int numEdges)
      A simple graph is an unweighted and undirected graph with no loops or multiple edges.A simple graph may be either connected or disconnected. This method randomly generates and returns such a simple graph given (valid) numbers of vertices and edges.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices.
      numEdges - the number of vertices.
      Returns:
      a random simple graph on the given number of vertices with the given number of edges.
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if no such simple graph can be generated.

    • erdosRenyi

      public static Graph erdosRenyi​(int numVertices, double probability)
      Generates and returns a random ErdÅ‘sâ€“RÃ©nyi graph on a given number of vertices, with an edge between any two vertices existing with some given probability.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices
      probability - the probability of choosing an edge.
      Returns:
      a random erdosRenyi graph on numVertices vertices, with an edge between any two vertices with probability probability.
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if the given probability is not between 0 and 1.

    • complete

      public static Graph complete​(int numVertices)
      A complete graph is a graph in which every pair of vertices is connected by a single unique edge. This method generates and returns the complete graph on a given number of vertices.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices.
      Returns:
      the complete graph on the given number of vertices.

    • completeBipartite

      public static Graph completeBipartite​(int numVer1, int numVer2)
      A bipartite graph (or simply bigraph) is a graph where the vertices can be divided into two disjoint, independent sets such that every edge connects a vertex in the first set to one in the second set. This method generates and returns a complete bipartite graph with numVer1 vertices in the first set and numVer2 vertices in the second set.
      Parameters:
      numVer1 - the number of vertices in the first partition.
      numVer2 - the number of vertices in the second partition.
      Returns:
      a complete bipartite graph on numVer1 and numVer2 vertices.

    • bipartite

      public static Graph bipartite​(int numVer1, int numVer2, int numEdges)
      Generates and returns a bipartite graph using the ErdÅ‘sâ€“RÃ©nyi model on numVer1 and numVer2 vertices with numEdges edges.
      Parameters:
      numVer1 - the number of vertices in the first partition.
      numVer2 - the number of vertices in the second partition.
      numEdges - the number of edges onto which to generate the graph.
      Returns:
      a random ErdÅ‘sâ€“RÃ©nyi bipartite graph on numVer1 and numVer2 vertices, containing a total of numEdges edges.
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if no such ErdÅ‘sâ€“RÃ©nyi bipartite graph can be generated.

    • bipartite

      public static Graph bipartite​(int numVer1, int numVer2, double probability)
      Returns a random ErdÅ‘sâ€“RÃ©nyi bipartite graph on numVer1 and numVer2 vertices, containing each possible edge with probability probability.
      Parameters:
      numVer1 - the number of vertices in the first partition.
      numVer2 - the number of vertices in the second partition.
      probability - the probability that the graph contains an edge with one endpoint in either side.
      Returns:
      a random erdosRenyi bipartite graph on numVer1 and numVer2 vertices, containing each possible edge with probability probability.
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if probability is not between 0 and 1.

    • path

      public static Graph path​(int numVertices)
      A path is a sequence of edges joining a given sequence of vertices. This method generates and returns a path graph on numVertices vertices.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the path
      Returns:
      a path graph on numVertices vertices

    • binaryTree

      public static Graph binaryTree​(int numVertices)
      A binary tree is a tree where each vertex has at most two children. A complete binary tree is a binary tree in which every level is completely filled (every vertex has exactly two children) and all nodes are as far left as possible. This method generates and returns a complete binary tree graph on numVertices vertices.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the binary tree
      Returns:
      a complete binary tree graph on numVertices vertices

    • cycle

      public static Graph cycle​(int numVertices)
      A cycle in a graph is a non-empty sequence of edges (a trail) in which the only repeated vertices are the first and last ones. This method generates and returns a cycle graph on numVertices vertices, a graph composed of a single cycle.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the cycle.
      Returns:
      a cycle graph on numVertices vertices.

    • eulerianPath

      public static Graph eulerianPath​(int numVertices, int numEdges)
      An Eulerian path is a path on a graph that visits each edge precisely once. This method generates and returns an Eulerian path graph on numVertices vertices.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the path
      numEdges - the number of edges in the path
      Returns:
      a graph that is an Eulerian path on numVertices vertices and numEdges edges
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if either numVertices <= 0 or numEdges < 0

    • eulerianCycle

      public static Graph eulerianCycle​(int numVertices, int numEdges)
      An Eulerian cycle is a graph cycle that has each edge in the cycle exactly once. This method generates and returns an Eulerian cycle graph on numVertices vertices.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the cycle.
      numEdges - the number of edges in the cycle.
      Returns:
      a graph that is an Eulerian cycle on numVertices vertices and numEdges edges
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if either numVertices <= 0 or numEdges <= 0

    • wheel

      public static Graph wheel​(int numVertices)
      A wheel graph is a single vertex connected to every vertex in a cycle. This method generates and returns a wheel graph on numVertices vertices.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the wheel
      Returns:
      a wheel graph on numVertices vertices
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if the number of vertices provided is not at least 2.

    • star

      public static Graph star​(int numVertices)
      A star graph is a tree with a single internal vertex and a given number of leaves. This method generates and returns a star graph on numVertices vertices.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the star.
      Returns:
      a star graph on numVertices vertices.

    • regular

      public static Graph regular​(int numVertices, int k)
      Returns a uniformly random k-regular graph on numVertices vertices. This graph is not necessarily ErdÅ‘sâ€“RÃ©nyi and is in fact ErdÅ‘sâ€“RÃ©nyi with probability only about e^(-k^2/4), which is tiny when k = 14.
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the graph
      k - degree of each vertex
      Returns:
      a uniformly random k-regular graph on numVertices vertices.
      Throws:
      java.lang.AssertionError - if the number of vertices multiplied by k is not even.

    • tree

      public static Graph tree​(int numVertices)
      Returns a uniformly random tree on numVertices vertices. This algorithm uses a PrÃ¼fer sequence, which is a unique sequence associated to a tree, and takes time proportional to numVertices log(numVertices).
      Parameters:
      numVertices - the number of vertices in the tree.
      Returns:
      a uniformly random tree on numVertices vertices.

    • getSeed

      public static long getSeed()
      Returns:
      the seed from StdRandom used to generate the pseudo-random values used to create random graphs.

    • setSeed

      public static void setSeed()
      Sets the seed attribute of this class to the seed attribute of the StdRandom instance used to generate random graphs.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Unit tests the GraphGenerator library.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments.
